title: スレッドの全てのメールを同時に開きたい

title: Thunderbird 147 release install gives error "XML-parsefout: ongedefinieerde entiteit"
creator: hans.bollen
content:
Hallo Mozilla Thunderbird support

I was executing this manual : https://support.mozilla.org/nl/kb/thunderbird-installeren-linux#w_thunderbird-handmatig-installeren-voor-een-specifiek-releasekanaal-voor-gevorderde-gebruikers.

Reason : I have installed Linux Mint 22.3 Cinnamon which came with Thunderbird 140 ers. My mail has been transferred from a computer (with problems), which used ? a younger ? version !?

I use Thunderbird for many years, with profile manager and 6 profiles in it. At the moment I cannot work with my mail. Which is bad for me ... >:-|

Starting thunderbird with thunderbird -P "You have launched an older version of Thunderbird" A newer version of Thunderbird may have made changes to your profile which are no longer compatible with this older version. Use this profile only with that newer version, or create a new profile for this installation of Thunderbird. Creating a new profile requires setting up your accounts, calendars and add-ons again.

I did worked al those instructions, which went good.

Almost done

I dont get the launcher on the desktop

Most important is this error popping up in a yellow box

This is the error XML-parsefout: ongedefinieerde entiteit Locatie: chrome://messenger/content/messenger.xhtml Regelnummer 48, kolom 1:

Please help

Thanks in advance

Hans Bollen hans.bollen@linuxzob.nl

https://www.linuxzob.nl/wiki https://www.linuxzob.nl/wiki/doku.php?id=linux_internet:thunderbird#thunderbird_mail_-_verjongen

title: Not able to send email via Thunderbird but receive email easily
creator: steve.lengyel9
content:
This month I downloaded the current version of Tbird on a new computer running windows 11. Tbird receives all my email but can not send mail. I have an old computer running on windows 7 which has Tbird that was loaded at least 5 years ago. It receives and sends email without problems. The two versions of Tbird are using the same SMTP settings: server: mail.twc.com Port: 587. My email account for Tbird is slengyel@triad.rr.com

I also have a gmail account which receives and sends on both computers without problems. My gmail account is steve.lengyel9@gmail.com.

Both computers run through the same internet network.

title: Remote content exceptions list needs improvement
creator: Black_Seraph
content:
Hello! After like 20+ years I wanted to return to Thunderbird and right after the start i stumbled upon a massive showstopper... The need to exclude every single address "variation" of a website and/or email address is not only annoying, but will also make Thunderbird slower and slower with time.

Why does the exception list for remote content not support wildcards? Why do I have to separately allow content from e.g. "invitations@linkedin.com", "messages-noreply@linkedin.com" and "messaging-digest-noreply@linkedin.com", instead of just allowing all content from a domain "*linkedin.com"?

Regards, Black Seraph.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/thunderbird-makes-unrequested-connections"]

title: Two Thunderbird Profiles suddenly result in immediate startup crashes
creator: jashillito
content:
Hello! The other day everything worked as usual, and I shut down the computer for the night. The next morning, Thunderbird immediately crashed/shut down when starting each of the 2 profiles I always use. The 3rd profile, which is the default-release running a different email, still seems to work normally. Thunderbird 115.10.1

I have tried Windows (10) safe mode, as well as thunderbird Troubleshoot mode and working offline, but the issue continued to occur.

I'm at a loss now as to what could cause 2 profiles to suddenly cause it to crash. By the way, one profile is for a gmail account and the other one is for an Outlook account, so they don't seem to be related.

In case it helps, there were 2 Microsoft Visual C++ programs installed or updated, and updates to Microsoft 365 and Google Drive just before the problem started. These were all auto updates in the background.

Any help from the Community would be greatly appreciated. Thank you!

title: Considering updating from Thunderbird 97.0b3(64 bit) to latest non-beta version
creator: MJPGILGO
content:
Hi! I am a tax accountant. Considering updating from Thunderbird 97.0b3(64 bit) to latest non-beta version. Is this feasible? Is there a separate/special update process from Beta to the latest? Also would like to continue to use my POP account set-up at Optimum(Cablevision) here on Long Island. Email (Outbound)SMTP and (inbound)POP mail servers have to remain the same. So initially , I have to backup all my existing Thunderbird data & Profile.

I have used Thunderbird for a long time; previously used Eudora. The problem which I am trying to prevent is that when I try to send a client their encrypted PDF of their tax returns and related instructions, etc. my document database or data magt system, namely File Cabinet Solutions show in the activity log "Waiting for user input" --- so no email is created which would have all the requisite documents attached. The last time helpful client send feature worked in my tax software, Ultratax, was June 27, 2025. Ultratax could not figure a solution, after several weeks & suggested that I upgrade my Thunderbird.. Can anyone help?

Thank you! Best, Mike Porcari--- 631-513-0823(cell)

title: Local folders in Google Drive
creator: nospam17
content: I currently use imap with my email hosting provider and has worked well with Thunderbird. However, speeds are getting slower and storage costs have gone up. I was wondering if Thunderbird's Local Folders default path (C:\Users\......\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\......\Mail\Local Folders) can be changed to a google drive folder on D:\ drive. If there are any risks in doing so. Thanks.
